results.description:
Description

Have a passion for fitness & Welness and a talent for sales? So why not do both?

At Arbox, we live and breathe health and wellness, providing a management software solution for small business owners

Our Saas product has disrupted the Fitness and Wellness industry across 25 countries worldwide with a hyper-growing amount of 1MM end users.

We have successfully penetrated various markets around the globe looking to expand into the Spanish\ Portuguese market

We are looking for a Freelance Account Manager to help develop and accelerate our growth in the European market!



About Us:

Our mission is to help small to medium owners transform from industry experts to business experts. Using Arbox allows our customers to simultaneously grow their businesses while focusing on doing what they do best – building their community and making their clients feel happy and fulfilled.

Arbox has an energized, innovative, fun, and supportive culture. We look for positive, friendly, creative, and dynamic people with a passion to succeed and join this amazing journey!



What your Arbox day will look like:
  • Managing prospective client relationships through all phases of the sales cycle 
  • Developing and maintaining prospect and customer lists based on strategic marketing data and other sources for sales leads
  • Schedule appointments and book demonstrations
  • Perform product demos using web tools to prospects and customers
  • Coordinating the sales team by managing schedules, coordinating meetings, filing important documents, and communicating relevant information.
  • Build a strong pipeline of prospects by sourcing potential leads.
  • Achieve and exceed monthly KPI’s and quota
Requirements

So what do we offer?

  • High commission and bonus packages
  • Work in a flexible, fast-paced global environment
  • Massive impact and room for personal growth
  • Combining your passions :)
  • If this is interesting please go to our website or send your resume to yael@arboxapp.com

results.title: Senior Account Manager
results.description:
Telco Experts Senior Account Manager Job Description

Telco Experts is a Voice and Data Telecommunications provider as well as a full-service consulting firm serving the business community with a passion for connecting people with what matters with integrity and compassion. The team of 20 employees are based out of 110 Wall Street in New York, NY and are mostly remote.

Position Summary

We are looking for a Senior Account Manager who will be able to think strategically, roll up their sleeves and dig into the data but also able to zoom out and work with the customer on the big picture as well. You will own relationships with our top customers and collaborate cross-functionally with the team to ensure our customers consistently receive first-class service. Our ideal candidate is passionate about using analytical skills to identify problems, find solutions, and improve relationships.

This position can be fully remote (preferable that you are in Central or Eastern time zone) and will pay a competitive salary ($70-80k) and a wide array of benefits including medical benefits and 401k matching programs. The position will start ASAP.

Objectives of this Role

  • Own overall relationship with assigned clients, which includes managing on-boarding, implementation, training, increasing adoption, ensuring retention, and high levels of customer satisfaction
  • Establish a trusted and strategic advisor relationship to help drive continued value of our products and services
  • Maintain and develop customer success strategies and best practices, as well as customer support content
  • Communicate effectively with both internal and external senior-level management to understand customer needs, maximize retention and growth, and communicate learnings
  • Maintain existing customer success metrics and data as directed

Daily and Monthly Responsibilities

  • Serve as day-to-day contact for assigned accounts, building trust and rapport while identifying areas of opportunity, highlighting best practices, and documenting them
  • Review the customer journey, identifying how it's supported, taking a consultative approach in helping clients overcome issues and achieve goals
  • Plan and lead quarterly strategic business reviews with our top customers
  • Collaborate, problem solve, and/or strategize upcoming client meetings with team members
  • Prepare necessary documentation or visuals for client to demonstrate performance of campaigns; analyze trends in CNPS scores to identify areas of improvement
  • Identify cross-sell opportunities within the base by analyzing customer data
  • Work with the sales team to drill customer references and develop case studies

Required Skills and Qualifications

  • Bachelor's degree
  • 2+ years of experience in sales, account management, or customer success
  • Strong verbal and written communication, strategic planning, and project management skills
  • Analytical and process-oriented mindset; organized
  • Comfortable working across multiple departments in a deadline-driven environment
  • Active team player, self-starter, and multitasker who can quickly adjust priorities
  • Energized by a high-growth environment and opportunity for increased responsibility
  • Spirit of continuous improvement to implement new processes
  • Experience with CRM (Hubspot experience a plus)
  • Proficient with Microsoft Office Applications with strong Excel skills
  • Telecom experience preferred

results.title: Account Manager
results.description:
Mod Op is a full-service advertising agency in search of an Account Manager who is looking for growth and opportunity. At Mod Op you’ll work with internationally-recognized clients who represent a wide range of industries. You'll contribute to projects that propel brands to new heights. You'll collaborate with a team of committed, motivated, and enthusiastic coworkers who see career development and personal development as intertwined. And, thanks to ongoing growth-by-acquisition directed by our former-venture-capitalist CEO and our team of industry leaders, Mod Op offers a compensation package that includes access to low-cost, high-quality benefits, 401k with company match, paid parental leave, and a generous time off policy. Remote and flexible work arrangements are available based on role.

This position performs a combination of duties mainly related to leveraging Mod Op’s expertise and offerings to positively impact our clients’ business objectives. In conjunction with their supervisor, the Account Manager leads and supervises the planning and execution of all marketing communication activities on assigned accounts. He or she contributes in strategic areas and actively encourages the same from all members of the team. The position requires someone who is detail-oriented, poised, confident and proactive with exceptional communications and client service skills.

Job Responsibilities

  • Serve as the primary point of contact for assigned clients with responsibility for managing the planning and execution of marketing communications activities
  • Be the expert on Client and Agency business and understand as much as possible about the customer
  • Ensure the timely and successful delivery of our solutions according to client needs and objectives
  • Clearly and consistently communicates to internal and external team members
  • Evaluate, analyze, report on program effectiveness based on key metrics and make recommendations for optimization
  • Assist supervisor with strategic development, program measurement and optimization recommendations
  • Serve as a trusted, reliable resource for clients
  • Be proactive, anticipate and solve problems

In addition, a top priority is contributing to the success of our clients as well as contributing to the creative and collaborative culture of the agency.

Requirements

Required Education and Experience

  • Bachelor’s degree
  • Four to six years of related work experience

 

Supervisory ResponsibilityThis position manages the client relationship(s) and is responsible for the internal team that services that client(s).

 

 

Position Type/Expected Hours of Work

Some flexibility in hours is allowed, but the employee must be available during the “core” work hours of 8:00 a.m. to 5:00 p.m. and must work at least 40 hours each week to maintain full-time status.

 

 

Preferred Education and Experience

  • Experience across multiple marketing communications disciplines – specifically creative, social media, web and media
  • Ability to manage multiple clients and projects simultaneously
  • Excellent organizational skills and the ability to be resourceful
  • Planning and project management
  • Strong verbal and written communication skills
  • Analytical skills

 

 

Additional Eligibility Qualifications

 

None

 

 

Other Duties

Please note this job description is not designed to cover or contain a comprehensive listing of activities, duties or responsibilities that are required of the employee for this job. Duties, responsibilities and activities may change at any time with or without notice.

Benefits

  • Health and Life Insurance for employee and family, access to Vision benefits, Telemedicine services, Psychology support and others.
  • On the job training and career growth opportunities
  • Fully remote job
  • Great team environment, collaborative offices, fun company culture with a great balance of work and play
  • Vacations are granted by day or weeks according to employee approved request.
  • Salary with yearly review and competitive benefits
  • Pay commensurate and competitive based on experience and skill set.

When asked what they love about working at Mod Op, we hear:

  • “I feel I can be myself at work and it’s fun!” -MV
  • “The caliber of the clients/brands we work with, knowing your work is seen by
  • thousands of people, in many cases across the world.” -JC
  • “We actually create videogames!” -AC
  • “We have an all-star team, and it’s like playing in the pro-bowl every day!” -MW
  • “Opportunities to always learn from and work with the best and the brightest.” HW
  • “Mentors and opportunities for growth.” -KB

Mod Op believes in teamwork, client collaboration, powerful storytelling, stunning design, and thoughtful problem-solving. Our clients represent a breadth of industries, and every project presents new and interesting challenges. We would love for you to join us!

results.title: Sales Account Manager
results.description:
NurseRecruiter is the largest nursing job board in the USA and we are looking for a qualified sales account manager to join our team. We are a 100% remote company and this is a 100% remote position so we are looking for someone anywhere in the United States. The base salary for this position is $40,000 USD per year with an unlimited commission plan that we expect to double the total compensation in the first year and grow from there.


You will be responsible for establishing and developing long-term relationships with customers and overseeing sales. As a sales account manager, you should work to satisfy customers’ needs and requests, respond to their queries in a timely manner and deliver a positive customer experience. You should have excellent communication and negotiation skills and be customer service oriented. Ultimately, you should be able to grow our business by building successful, long-term client relationships.

 

Responsibilities
  • Manage a portfolio of accounts to achieve long-term success
  • Develop positive relationships with clients
  • Act as the point of contact and handle customers’ individual needs
  • Generate new business using existing and potential customer networks
  • Resolve conflicts and provide solutions to customers in a timely manner
  • Supervise account representatives to ensure sales increase
  • Report on the status of accounts and transactions
  • Set and track sales account targets, aligned with company objectives
  • Monitor sales metrics (e.g. quarterly sales results and annual forecasts)
  • Suggest actions to improve sales performance and identify opportunities for growth

Requirements

  • Proven work experience as a sales account manager or sales account executive
  • Hands on experience in sales and an ability to deliver excellent customer experience
  • Excellent communication and negotiation skills
  • Business acumen with a problem-solving attitude

results.title: Account Executive
results.description:
Cloudsmith is looking for an exceptional full-time New Business Account Executive to work remotely. If you are hungry, nimble, and intelligent - with the ability and willingness to nurture leads and close business, we are looking for you.

 

Cloudsmith is a leader in software supply chain management. Allowing organizations to manage software via the cloud, eliminating the need to hire dedicated support staff to handle expensive and unwieldy on-premises solutions.

 

Our artifact management platform helps teams secure their software supply chain by providing a single place to store all their software assets. We provide a place to collect all the

  • external dependencies your team ingests,
  • custom software packages you create,
  • containers (eg Docker images)
  • Terraform modules
  • Helm charts (for container orchestration)

 

We help you control and manage these assets, automatically scan for vulnerabilities and malware, and improve your development team’s productivity.

You will be responsible for engaging and qualifying inbound leads, developing them into sales-qualified opportunities, and growing new business.

We are looking to expand our sales team and bring the value of our cloud-native offering to organizations.

 

About You, The Ideal Candidate

  • You are the customer’s champion. At Cloudsmith we aim to serve our customers by managing expectations and delivering what we promise.
  • You're entrepreneurial-minded. Enjoying the challenge of expanding new territory and having the ability in building a land-and-expand strategy.
  • You’re passionate about selling and technology and open to learning new things.
  • A team player. You understand selling is a team effort and partnering with your sales engineering counterparts is the path to success.
  • A skilled negotiator with the ability to quickly identify the right solutions that meet the customers’ needs to create a win-win situation.
  • You are skilled at driving projects in a startup environment with minimal guidance and limited resources while having the freedom and creativity to continue moving forward. You roll up your sleeves and drive execution and results.
  • You love to share a better way that you believe in with others as you know it will enrich their careers.
  • You exude the qualities and core values of Cloudsmith: loving automation, striving for simplicity, teaching others, and being humble.

 

In short, your qualities:

1. Smart. �

2. Gets Things Done �

3. An Awesome Human Being. �

 

Responsibilities

You will be responsible for qualifying inbound leads (MQLs) and developing them into sales-qualified opportunities.

  • Proactively engage with prospects and follow up with clients to meet their needs.
  • Nurture qualified leads and drive to conversion.
  • Develop an active and vibrant pipeline equal to 3x quota.
  • Offer initial solution overview and help identify customer goals/challenges.
  • Develop excellent relationships with potential and existing clients.
  • Performing research on accounts to help increase interest in the organization and our commercial offerings.
  • Prepare activity reports and update and maintain Salesforce.com.
  • Assist sales management in conveying customer needs to the marketing and technical support team.
  • Provide quotes, proposals, and support to senior sales.
  • Take ownership of rescheduling any postponed meetings and prompt follow-up of inbound inquiries.
  • Other responsibilities as needed.

 

Experience

  • Demonstrated success in meeting sales goals with a solid track record.
  • 5 years of sales-related experience.
  • Proven experience in sales within the IT sector. Ideally, you would have sold or prospected software, cloud, or DevOps solutions.
  • Proficiency in working in various CRM, sales prospecting tools, and web-based conferencing systems e.g MS Office suite, Salesforce.com, Intercom, and Zoom.
  • Ability to comfortably engage with technical buyers and procurement.
  • Great written and oral communication skills for creating professional documents and giving presentations to interested clients.
  • Excellent time management and organizational skills.
  • Ability to listen to concerns and handle criticism.
  • Positive attitude and want to be part of an energetic sales environment.
  • Expertise in conflict resolution.
  • Hungry to learn, genuinely curious, and know how to get the answers to your questions.

 

Working for Cloudsmith

You will be working as part of the core team to help drive more customer adoption with this game-changing technology.

 

The company is growing fast and we are focused on everyone at Cloudsmith to have a real impact on the company and our customers every day. We are driven, focused, and encourage creativity and collaboration.

 

About The Location

We’re based in Belfast, Northern Ireland, but like us and the entire team right now, you’ll be fully remote, with 24/7 access to a BT1 office space. We serve customers in the US and EMEA regions.

 

About Equal Opportunity

We’re an equal opportunities employer that does not discriminate against age, sex, gender, pronouns, race, disability, pregnancy, marital or parental status, political ideology, creed, sexual orientation, religious background, etc. Your ability and passion are infinitely more important to us.

 

Covid 19

Cloudsmith is committed to supporting Covid-19 vaccinations. We encourage our employees and their family members to get vaccinated, as it is the best way to limit the spread of COVID-19 and keep you, your family, our workforce, and communities healthy.

 

Requirements

  • 3-5 years sales related experience in B2B Saas/technology sales

- Prospecting, value-based / consultative selling, using effective discovery questions & identifying relevant customer initiatives

  • Industry knowledge

- DevOps, continuous integration & continuous deployment, containers (eg Docker), container orchestration (eg Kubernetes)

  • University degree (essential)

- Master's degree (or MBA) is desirable

Benefits

For excellent candidates like you, expect an incredible opportunity and compensation

💙 Extremely competitive salary

💙 25 days annual leave + 8 optional public holidays

💙 Birthday Day Off

💙 Remote & Flexible working policies

💙 Health / dental insurance

💙 Great pension contributions (matched up to 8%)

💙 Maternity/Paternity/Adoptive Leave

💙 Diversity, Equity & Inclusion Employer

💙 Branded hoodie, t-shirt, socks & swag

💙 Extra perks, like free conference days, or support for additional self-learning
